TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantines[COLOR_REVERT] are relatively pricey [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT]. They have four cargo slots, and also four speed, but they are stronger than [LINK=UNIT_MERCHANTMAN]Merchantmen[\LINK] and especially well-protected against [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK], against whom they receive a 10% Defensive bonus.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brigantines[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Un navire de commerce sûr, solide et fiable.
TEXT.German: Eine [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] ist ein starkes, gut geschütztes Handelsschiff.
TEXT.Italian: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong and well protected merchant vessel.
TEXT.Spanish: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong and well protected merchant vessel.

TEXT.English: [TAB] In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship (also known as one of the escort types) with a single gun deck that carried anything up to eighteen cannons. As the rating system covered all vessels with 20 guns and above, this meant that the term sloop-of-war actually encompassed all the unrated combat vessels including the very small gun-brigs and cutters. In technical terms, even the more specialised bomb vessels and fireships were classed as sloops-of-war, and in practice these were actually employed in the sloop role when not carrying out their specialised functions. A ship sloop was generally the equivalent of the smaller corvette of the French Navy (although the French term also covered ships up up to 24 guns, which were classed as 'post ships' within the Sixth Rate of the British Navy). The name corvette was subsequently also applied to British vessels, but not until the 1830s. A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "captain". Until 1794 the master and commander strictly speaking held the permenent rank of lieutenant, and reverted to that rank when he gave up command of the sloop-of-war; in 1794 the rank of commander was created.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Au temps de la marine à voile, le sloop (de la même origine étymologique que le français chaloupe), ou plus exactement le sloop-of-war, désignait en Angleterre, les navires plus petits que les frégates, armés de dix à dix-huit canons sur un seul pont. Les Anglais distinguaient deux variantes principales de sloop : le ship sloop qui, avec ses trois mâts, équivalait à peu près à la corvette française ; le brig sloop avec deux mâts, est appelé brick en France. Au début du XXe siècle, le terme sloop désignait un navire d'escorte anti sous-marin, armé de canon de 102 mm et de grenades sous-marines. Lors de la Seconde Guerre mondiale, il a cédé la place aux corvettes, puis aux frégates.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Die Kriegsschiffbezeichnung Sloop hat ihren Ursprung in dem gleichnamigen einmastigen Schiffstyp. Sie bildeten im 17. Jahrhundert die kleinsten bewaffneten Marineeinheiten für Unterstützungsaufgaben wie Nachrichtenübermittlung und Aufklärung und waren im Gegensatz zu grösseren Schiffen nicht klassifiziert. Diese Fahrzeuge hatten zunächst einen Leutnant als Kommandanten, jedoch ohne weiteren Offizier, vor allem aber keinen Navigator/Segelmeister (engl. Sailing-Master oder kurz Master). Weil Unterstützungsfahrzeuge in der Seekriegsführung im Verlaufe des 17. Jahrhundert immer bedeutender wurden und vor allem auch abseits der Küsten operierten, wurde auch ein Navigator notwendig. Daraus entstand der Rang des Master and Commander, ein kommandierender Seeoffizier, der zugleich Navigator war.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship (also known as one of the escort types) with a single gun deck that carried anything up to eighteen cannons. As the rating system covered all vessels with 20 guns and above, this meant that the term sloop-of-war actually encompassed all the unrated combat vessels including the very small gun-brigs and cutters. In technical terms, even the more specialised bomb vessels and fireships were classed as sloops-of-war, and in practice these were actually employed in the sloop role when not carrying out their specialised functions. A ship sloop was generally the equivalent of the smaller corvette of the French Navy (although the French term also covered ships up up to 24 guns, which were classed as 'post ships' within the Sixth Rate of the British Navy). The name corvette was subsequently also applied to British vessels, but not until the 1830s. A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "captain". Until 1794 the master and commander strictly speaking held the permenent rank of lieutenant, and reverted to that rank when he gave up command of the sloop-of-war; in 1794 the rank of commander was created.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship (also known as one of the escort types) with a single gun deck that carried anything up to eighteen cannons. As the rating system covered all vessels with 20 guns and above, this meant that the term sloop-of-war actually encompassed all the unrated combat vessels including the very small gun-brigs and cutters. In technical terms, even the more specialised bomb vessels and fireships were classed as sloops-of-war, and in practice these were actually employed in the sloop role when not carrying out their specialised functions. A ship sloop was generally the equivalent of the smaller corvette of the French Navy (although the French term also covered ships up up to 24 guns, which were classed as 'post ships' within the Sixth Rate of the British Navy). The name corvette was subsequently also applied to British vessels, but not until the 1830s. A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "captain". Until 1794 the master and commander strictly speaking held the permenent rank of lieutenant, and reverted to that rank when he gave up command of the sloop-of-war; in 1794 the rank of commander was created.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are the fastest Naval Units in the game, and because of that, they are particularly suitable for exploring the seas of the New World and searching out [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT3]Shipwrecks[\LINK]. They have only one cargo slot, which makes them practically useless as trading vessels, but they can transport [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Military Units[\LINK] very swiftly to the places where they are needed.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] can cheaply be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Même si peu puissants, les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]sloops[COLOR_REVERT] sont d'excellents navires de reconnaissance qui peuvent achever des navires déjà endommagés.
TEXT.German: Obwohl eine [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloop[COLOR_REVERT] kein besonders starkes Kriegsschiff ist, eignet es sich hervorragend zur Aufklärung und auch dazu angeschlagenen Schiffen den Rest zu geben.
TEXT.Italian: Although not very strong, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent for reconaissance and finishing off damaged ships.
TEXT.Spanish: Although not very strong, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent for reconaissance and finishing off damaged ships.

French.Text: Navire des Indes Occidentales:Navires des Indes Occidentales

TEXT.English: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Le navire des Indes a été conçu pour transporter à la fois des biens et des passagers avec un système défensif contre la piraterie. Dans la période des guerres napoléoniennes, ils étaient souvent décorés à la manière de bateaux de guerre. Un attaquant ne pouvait ainsi être sûr qu'il s'agissait de réelles défenses ou de décoration.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Großer Westindienfahrer wurden entworfen und gebaut um sowohl Passagiere, wie auch Waren zu transportieren. Ein Hauptaugenmerk, war die Fähigkeit sich gegen Piraten zu verteidigen. Durch diese speziellen Eigenschaften stellten sie eine eigene Schiffsklasse dar. Für einen Angreifer ware sie aus der Entfernung oft kaum von einem reinen Kriegsschiff zu unterscheiden. Einige waren tatsächlich relativ schwach bewaffnet, andere jedoch führten eine beachtliche Anzahl an Kanonen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiamen[COLOR_REVERT] are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT] available. They have five cargo slots and five speed, and on top of that, are strong enough to match [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK] in combat and have even less to fear from [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK]. Because of their strength and ability to attack, the West Indiaman can function both as merchant ship and as warship.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]West Indiamen[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]Shipyard[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]navire des Indes Occidentales[COLOR_REVERT] est un navire de commerce puissant. Le volume de sa cargaison est cependant réduit pour laisser place à des canons.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großer Westindienfahrer[COLOR_REVERT] ist ein sehr starkes Handelsschiff, welches im Vergleich zur Galeone zwar weniger Frachtraum dafür aber mehr Kanonen hat.
TEXT.Italian: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiaman[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong trading ship, although it lacks some cargo capacity compared to the Galeon due to the higher amount of cannons.
TEXT.Spanish: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiaman[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong trading ship, although it lacks some cargo capacity compared to the Galeon due to the higher amount of cannons.

TEXT.English: The smugglers we have hired await your orders in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: Les contrebandiers que nous avons recrutés attendent vos ordres à %s1_city, Sir.
TEXT.German: Die angeheuerten Schmuggler erwarten in %s1_city Eure Befehle, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: The smugglers we have hired await your orders in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: The smugglers we have hired await your orders in %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les navires conçus pour la contrebande étaient généralement des structures bon-marché construite en bois de sapin. Comparé au traditionnel chêne, le sapin n'était pas seulement économique, mais également plus léger, ce qui donnait aux vaisseaux un avantage pour s'échapper des navires royaux. Les navires de contrebande étaient également équipés de fusils et de petits canons à rotation pour la défense.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Schmugglerschiffe wurden meist sehr günstig und vorallem zweckmässig gebaut. Oft aus günstigerem Holz, wie Tanne. Verglichen mit den traditionellen Bauweisen mit Eiche und anderen Harthölzern, sparte dies nicht nur Kosten, sondern auch Gewicht, was wiederum zu höheren Endgeschwindigkeiten führte um den Königlichen Zollschiffen zu entgehen. Bewaffnet waren Schmugglerschiffe meist nur mit leichten Handwaffen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Smuggling Ships[COLOR_REVERT] are small, stealthy vessels that can be used to circumvent the high [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Tax Rate[\LINK] your [LINK=RELATIONS_WITH_KING]King[\LINK] has imposed upon you. They have two cargo slots, and they can be purchased only in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. While they release you from the duty to pay your taxes, they do demand a small fee, which they need to bribe the King's officials.[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK], and for more information about Smuggling, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piracy and Smuggling[\LINK]
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]navires de contrebande[COLOR_REVERT] vous permettent de vendre des biens sans payer de taxer, et même de vendre des biens boycottés en Europe.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Schmugglerschiffe[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglichen es die Steuern in Europa zu umgehen und selbst boykottierte Waren zu verkaufen.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Smuggling Ships[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to sell goods withouth paying taxes and even sell boycotted goods in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Smuggling Ships[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to sell goods withouth paying taxes and even sell boycotted goods in Europe.

TEXT.French: [TAB]%d1%% Pot-de-vin : %d2[ICON_GOLD]
TEXT.German: [TAB]%d1%% Bestechung: %d2[ICON_GOLD]
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]%d1%% Bribe: %d2[ICON_GOLD]
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]%d1%% Bribe: %d2[ICON_GOLD]

TEXT.English: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le garde forestier est généralement un fonctionnaire chargé de patrouiller (éventuellement à cheval) dans la forêt et d'autres endroits dans la nature. Il peut aussi dans certains pays s'agir de gardes privés. En Amérique du Nord, les gardes-forestiers constituent une réserve militaire qui peut servir en combat en tant de guerre. Ils furent ainsi utiliser à partir de la guerre du Roi Philippe (1676), puis dans tous les conflits successifs jusqu'à la guerre de Sécession.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Die Rangers berufen sich auf die Tradition der ersten Siedler in den USA, die unter Ausnutzung des Geländes gegen Indianer und britische oder französische Truppen kämpften. Namenspatron sind Rogers' Rangers, die unter Robert Rogers auf britischer Seite im Franzosen- und Indianerkrieg kämpften. Dessen zusammengestellter Ausbildungsplan aus Berichten der Rogers Ranger sind u.a. bis heute noch Grundlage des Kleinen Krieges. Auch im amerikanischen Bürgerkrieg waren Ranger-Einheiten, vor allem auf konföderierter Seite als Bushwhacker, hinter den feindlichen Linien eingesetzt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rangers[COLOR_REVERT] are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are experts for terrain and covert operations. Use them wisely for ambushes or getting deep behind enemy lines.[NEWLINE]Rangers get bonuses when fighting in vegetated areas. This bonus applies to both attack and defense, so while the other Terrain unit, the [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenary[\LINK] is particularly strong when attacking in the wild, the Ranger is stronger when defending.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rangers are invisible to almost all units of other European nations, as well as the Royal Army. They can be obtained only by certain [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK]
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gardes-forestiers[COLOR_REVERT] sont des experts de terrain pour les opérations sous couvertures. Utilisez les pour vous enfoncer dans les lignes ennemies et faire des embuscades.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rangers[COLOR_REVERT] sind Experten für Gelände und versteckte Operationen. Man sollte sie weise für Hinterhalte oder für Aktionen tief hinter den feindlichen Linien nutze.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rangers[COLOR_REVERT]are experts for terrain and covert operations. Use them wisely for ambushes or getting deep behind enemy lines.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rangers[COLOR_REVERT] are experts for terrain and covert operations. Use them wisely for ambushes or getting deep behind enemy lines.

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Invisible dans la forêt.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]In Wäldern unsichtbar.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Invisible while in Forests.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Invisible while in Forests.

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Peut voir les gardes-forestiers.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Kann Ranger sehen.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Can see Rangers.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Can see Rangers.

TEXT.English: A new unit of Rangers awaits your commands in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: Une nouvelle unité de gardes-forestiers attend vos ordres à %s1_city, Sir.
TEXT.German: Eine neue Einheit Rangers erwartet Ihre Befehle in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: A new unit of Rangers awaits your commands in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: A new unit of Rangers awaits your commands in %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les Conquistadors (terme qui signifie conquérant en castillan) sont les officiers, les explorateurs et plus généralement les chefs d'expédition qui ont exploré puis envahi le Nouveau Monde du XVe siècle au XVIIe siècle. De manière plus générale, on appelle aussi Conquistador, l'ensemble des aventuriers espagnols ou portugais partis à la conquête de l'Amérique. Cet épisode de l'histoire est désigné sous le terme colonisation espagnole des Amériques.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Conquistadores sind Berufssoldaten, die ein breites Spektrum von Kampftaktiken und Waffen einsetzten. Ihre Verbände spezialisierten sich oft auf Kriegsführung, die langes Training bedurfte und für andere Truppenteile zu kostspielig war. Viele junge Europäer traten Einheiten von Conquistadores bei, weil sie sich dadurch einen Weg aus der Armut versprachen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT], experienced in fighting in close combat, which is the way [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] would usually fight. Their aptitude in the area of slaughtering Natives makes them quite valuable forces in wars against them, but they will have a hard time fighting other European forces.[PARAGRAPH:1]Conquistadores can only be obtained through [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] and some [LINK=GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]conquistadors[COLOR_REVERT] sont spécialisés dans le combat rapproché, qui est le mode usuel de combat chez les indigènes.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] sind sehr erfahren in Nahkampf-Situationen und eignen sich deshalb hervorragend für den Kampf gegen Unreinwohner in schwierigem Gelände.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are experienced in fighting in close combat, which is the way Natives would usually fight.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are experienced in fighting in close combat, which is the way Natives would usually fight.

TEXT.English: The Conquistadors from Europe have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: Les conquistadors venus d'Europe sont arrivés à %s1_city, Sir.
TEXT.German: Conquistadores aus Europe sind in %s1_city angekommen, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: The Conquistadors from Europe have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: The Conquistadors from Europe have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT], like regular [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK], are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are experienced in fighting in close combat, against enemies both on foot or mounted.[NEWLINE]Due to their horses they fight best in open terrain. They are especially strong against [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK], but they can make a valuable contribution in wars against other [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Europeans[\LINK] as well.[PARAGRAPH:1]They can only be obtained through [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] or certain [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadors montés[COLOR_REVERT] sont des unités spécialisées dans le combat rapproché. Il est préférable de combattre l'ennemi en terrain découvert, puisque les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadors montés[COLOR_REVERT] ne reçoivent pas de bonus de défense.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] sind sehr erfahren in Nahkampf-Situationen und eignen sich deshalb hervorragend für den Kampf gegen Unreinwohner oder berittene Einheiten. Allerdings eignen sie sich auf Grund der Pferde nur für den Kampf in offenem Gelände.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are experienced in fighting in close combat, against enemies on foot or mounted. Due to their horses they fight best in open terrain.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are experienced in fighting in close combat, against enemies on foot or mounted. Due to their horses they fight best in open terrain.

TEXT.German: Abtei

TEXT.French: Commerce
TEXT.German: Handel
TEXT.Italian: Trade
TEXT.Spanish: Trade

TEXT.English: [TAB]Before Slaves from Africa were brought to the New World, the use of labour from enslaved Natives was widely spread, especially in South and Central America.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Avant l'arrivée des esclaves venus d'Afrique, l'usage d'indigènes capturés comme esclaves était très répandu, particulièrement en Amérique du Sud et en Amérique Centrale.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bevor Sklaven aus Afrika in großen Mengen in die Neue Welt gebracht wurden, war der Handel mit versklavten Ureinwohnern weit verbreitet. Vorallem in Süd- und Zentralamerika.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Before Slaves from Africa were brought to the New World, the use of labour from enslaved Natives was widely spread, especially in South and Central America.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Before Slaves from Africa were brought to the New World, the use of labour from enslaved Natives was widely spread, especially in South and Central America.

TEXT.English: You can acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Native Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] from conquered [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Villages[\LINK], by buying war prisoners of other Natives or by capturing Raiding Parties. They are a slightly less effective than [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK] which voluntarily join you, and they can also attempt to flee. They are especially productive when set to work on the fields, but will accomplish next to nothing when put to work inside a building.[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Servants, Criminals and Slaves[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Vous obtenez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]esclaves indigène[COLOR_REVERT] lors de la conquête de villages amérindiens ou en achetant des prisonniers aux civilisations indigènes en guerre avec d'autres tribus. Ils sont un peu moins efficaces au travail que les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]indigènes convertis[COLOR_REVERT] qui eux vous rejoignent volontairement.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Versklavte Ureinwohner[COLOR_REVERT] können durch die Eroberung von Ureinwohnerdörfern oder durch Kauf Kriegsgefangener anderer Ureinwohner erlangt werden. Sie sind etwas weniger effektiv als Konvertierte Ureinwohner, die sich euch freiwillig anschliessen.
TEXT.Italian: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Native Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] from conquered Native Villages of by buying war prisoners of other Natives, that currently lead war against another tribe. They are a little bit less effective than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Converted Natives[COLOR_REVERT] which voluntarily join you
TEXT.Spanish: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Native Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] from conquered Native Villages of by buying war prisoners of other Natives, that currently lead war against another tribe. They are a little bit less effective than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Converted Natives[COLOR_REVERT] which voluntarily join you

TEXT.English: The Native Slaves we bought have been delivered to %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: Les Esclaves indigènes que nous avons achetés sont arrivés à %s1_city, Sir.
TEXT.German: Die Ureinwohnersklaven die wir gekauft haben, wurden nach %s1_city geliefert, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: I nativi schiavi che abbiamo comprato sono stati consegnati a %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: Los esclavos nativos compramos han sido entregados a %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.
TEXT.French: [TAB]On estime à 12 millions le nombre d'africains arrivés aux Amériques entre le 16ème et le 19ème siècle. Parmi ceux-ci, environ 645 000 sont arrivés aux actuels Etats-Unis. On estime généralement à 15% le taux de mortalité des captifs pendant le voyage.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Kolonisierung Amerikas vom 16. bis 19. Jahrhundert ging mit einer Massenversklavung von Afrikanern einher, die in allen Teilen des dünn besiedelten Doppelkontinents als billige Arbeitskräfte eingesetzt wurden. Dies betrifft nicht nur die britischen, niederländischen, schwedischen, französischen und spanischen Kolonien, aus denen später die USA entstanden sind, sondern in noch grösserem Umfang Brasilien und die europäischen Kolonien in der Karibik. Auf dem nordamerikanischen Festland erlangte die Sklaverei jedoch Ausprägungsformen, die auf dem Doppelkontinent einzigartig waren, und nach der Gründung der USA stand sie im Spannungsfeld zwischen einer Ökonomie, die auf der Arbeitsleistung von Sklaven erbaut war, und dem politischen Programm einer jungen Nation, deren Selbstverständnis prominent die Idee der Freiheit zugrundelag.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.

TEXT.English: You can buy [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] for very low prices in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK]. They function the same as [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK], and they can also attempt to flee. They are especially productive when set to work on the fields, but will accomplish next to nothing when put to work inside a building.[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Servants, Criminals and Slaves[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Vous obtiendrez des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]esclaves africains[COLOR_REVERT] en commerçant avec l'Afrique. Ce sont d'excellents travailleurs pour les activités agricoles.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sklaven[COLOR_REVERT] werden durch Handel mit Afrika erlangt. Sie sind exzellente Feldarbeiter. Sklaven können davonlaufen.
TEXT.Italian: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] through trade with Africa. They are very good workers on plot professions.
TEXT.Spanish: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] through trade with Africa. They are very good workers on plot professions.

TEXT.English: The Slaves we bought from Africa have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: Les esclaves que nous avons acheté en Afrique sont arrivés en %s1_city, Sir.
TEXT.German: Die Sklaven aus Afrika wurden nach %s1_city geliefert, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: Gli schiavi che abbiamo comprato dall'Africa sono arrivati in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: Los esclavos que compramos de África han llegado %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [TAB]It is the task and responsibility of a bishop to act as spiritual leader of a colony. Guiding and supporting other preachers and priests to bring true christian believe to the citizens, converting the savages and to ensure that no soul leaves the righteous path of enlightment. Bringing bishops to your colonies is a save way to drastically increas immigration from the old world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un évêque est celui qui a autorité apostolique sur une Église chrétienne particulière. Les évêques assument à ce titre la succession des apôtres qui les ont établis à la tête d'une communauté chrétienne d'un territoire défini. Dans le langage juridique du droit canonique il est appelé ordinaire local. Chaque évêque d'aujourd'hui a été ordonné par un ou plusieurs évêques issus d'une chaîne d'ordonnateurs qui, théoriquement, remonte dans le temps jusqu'à un des apôtres du Christ. C'est ce qu'on appelle la succession apostolique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Es ist die Aufgabe und die Verantwortung des Bischofs als geistige Führung in den Kolonien, die Prediger anzuleiten und in ihrer Aufgabe zu unterstützen die Gläubigen zu führen, die Heiden zu bekehren und sicherzustellen, dass niemand vom Pfad der Gerechten abkommt. Einen Bischof in die Kolonien zu bringen ist eine sichere Methode die Immigration wesentlich zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]It is the task and responsibility of a bishop to act as spiritual leader of a colony. Guiding and supporting other preachers and priests to bring true christian believe to the citizens, converting the savages and to ensure that no soul leaves the righteous path of enlightment. Bringing bishops to your colonies is a save way to drastically increas immigration from the old world.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]It is the task and responsibility of a bishop to act as spiritual leader of a colony. Guiding and supporting other preachers and priests to bring true christian believe to the citizens, converting the savages and to ensure that no soul leaves the righteous path of enlightment. Bringing bishops to your colonies is a save way to drastically increas immigration from the old world.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bishops[COLOR_REVERT] are the best source of [LINK=YIELD_CROSSES]Crosses[\LINK] a colony could wish for. They are even more effective than [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Firebrand Preachers[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_PRIEST]Devout Priests[\LINK], as they receive a 150% bonus in Crosses production, but they are also very rare. You can recruit them at the rare moments the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] offers to send you a Bishop as a reward for your piety.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]évêques[COLOR_REVERT] sont la meilleure source de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]croix[COLOR_REVERT] qu'une colonie peut souhaiter. Ils sont encore plus efficaces que les prédicateurs exaltés, ou les prêtres dévôts mais également très rares.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bischöfe[COLOR_REVERT] sind die beste Quelle für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kreuze[COLOR_REVERT], die sich eine Kolonie wünschen kann. Sie sind sogar noch effektiver als ein Hetzprediger, allerdings auch viel seltener.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bishops[COLOR_REVERT] are the best source of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Crosses[COLOR_REVERT] a colony could wish for. They are even more effective than Firebrand Preachers or Devout Priests but also very rare.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bishops[COLOR_REVERT] are the best source of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Crosses[COLOR_REVERT] a colony could wish for. They are even more effective than Firebrand Preachers or Devout Priests but also very rare.

TEXT.English: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The role of the corvette consisted mostly of coastal patrol, fighting minor wars, supporting large fleets, or participating in show-the-flag missions. The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.
TEXT.French: La corvette est une catégorie de petit navire de guerre, léger et rapide, qui apparaît en France à la fin du XVIIe siècle. C'est d'abord un petit trois mâts, qui n'est jamais armé de plus de vingt canons en batterie, qui sert à effectuer des missions de découverte. Il sert aussi de liaison pour transmettre des ordres ou des courriers. De nombreuses corvettes serviront par la suite au transport marchand. Sa taille au fil des siècles augmente au point que les corvettes de l'ère révolutionnaire valent les Frégates légères, de 6 et de 8, du siècle précédent.
TEXT.German: Während des Zeitalters der Selgelschiffe waren Corvette kleinere bis mittlere Kriegsschiffe. Die Aufgabe der Corvette bestand üblicherweise aus Küstenpatroulien und Unterstüzung grösserer Flotten. Die Englische Navy begann die Nutzung solcher Schiffe in den 1650ern, nannte sie aber zu beginn eher Sloop-Of-War, als Corvette. Die erste namentliche Reference einer Corvette findet sich in der Französichen Marine um 1670 und gilt als der Ursprung dieser Bezeichnugn. Die Bezeichnung Corvette diente ab diesem Zeitpunkt zur Beschreibung eines Schiffes, welches kleiner als eine Frigatte, aber grösser als eine Sloop war.
TEXT.Italian: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The role of the corvette consisted mostly of coastal patrol, fighting minor wars, supporting large fleets, or participating in show-the-flag missions. The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.
TEXT.Spanish: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The role of the corvette consisted mostly of coastal patrol, fighting minor wars, supporting large fleets, or participating in show-the-flag missions. The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent escorts for your merchant ships and especially well suited for hunting [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK], receiving a 20% attack bonus against both. They are fast units, and cheaper to purchase than [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Frigates[\LINK]. In combat, though, they will not stand much of a chance against Frigates, or other ships that are even stronger.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]Shipyard[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Blades[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] sont d'excellentes escortes pour vos navires marchands et particulièrement adaptés à la chasse aux corsaires. Elles ne font cependant pas le poids face à des navires de guerres plus imposants comme les frégates et ne peuvent pas bombarder les villes.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvetten[COLOR_REVERT] sind excellent als Eskorte für Handelsschiffe oder zur Jagd auf Piraten geeignet. vFür grössere Kriegsschiffe, wie eine Frigatte, ein Linienschiff oder gar ein königliches Linienschiff, stellen sie jedoch keine ernsthafte Herausforderung dar. Desweiteren können sie keine Städte bombardieren.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent escorts for your merchant ships and very well suited for hunting Privateers. However, they are no real match for bigger warships like Frigates, Ships of the Line or Man-O-Wars and also cannot bombard cities.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent escorts for your merchant ships and very well suited for hunting Privateers. However, they are no real match for bigger warships like Frigates, Ships of the Line or Man-O-Wars and also cannot bombard cities.

TEXT.English: Towards the end of the 15th century, the caravel was occasionally modified by giving it the same rig as a carrack with a foresail, square mainsail and lateen mizzen, but not the carrack's high forecastle or much of a sternpalace, which would make it unweatherly. In this form it was sometimes known as caravela redonda (a bulging square sail is said to be round, redonda, in the Iberian tradition). It was in such ships that Christopher Columbus set out on his expedition in 1492 - Santa Maria was a ~100 ton carrack (same as: nau) which served as the flagship, and Pinta and Niña were smaller caravels of around 15-20 m with a beam of 6 m and displacing around 60-75 tons. In the first half of the 16th century, the Portuguese created a specialized fighting ship also called caravela redonda to act as an escort in Brazil and in the East Indies route. It had a foremast with square sails and three other masts with a lateen each, for a total of 4 masts. The hull was galleon-shaped, and some experts consider this vessel a forerunner of the fighting galleon. The Portuguese Man o' War was named after this curious type of fighting ship which was in use until the 17th century.
TEXT.French: A la fin du 15ème siècle, la caravelle a été modifiée pour augmenter en gabarit en empruntant des éléments de la caraque : dont une voile avant, un voile principale et un artimon à l'arrière. On parlera alors de caravela redonda (la voile principale carrée étant dite ronde, ou redonda, lorsque gonflée par le vent). Lors de l'expédition de Christophe Colomb en 1492, la Pinta et la Nina était deux caravelas redondas ; le navire principale, la Santa Maria, étant une caraque.
TEXT.German: Gegen Ende des 15ten Jahrunderts wurde die Caravelle manchmal modfifiziert indem man ihr ein Rig-Segel als Frontsegel, ein Rechteck-Segel als Hauptsegel und ein Lateen-Selge in der Mitte gabe, aber nicht aber nicht die hohen Anbauten an Front und Bug anbrachte. In dieser Form war sie als Caravela Redonda bekannt. In solchen Schiffen setzte Christoph Columbus Segel für seine Expedition im Jahre 1492. In der ersten Hälfte des 16ten Jahrunderts setzten die Portugiesen diese Schiffe auch als Eskorten auf ihren Handelsrouten nach Brasilien ein.

TEXT.English: Among [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] are smaller and have less cargo space than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT], but faster and more maneuverable. They have three cargo slots, so they still are quite useful as trading vessels. They are slightly stronger than [LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL]Caravels[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_FLUYT]Fluyts[\LINK], and also have the ability to attack other units, but they usually don't stand much of a chance in combat with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Warships[COLOR_REVERT] or [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Pirate Ships[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] sont des navires à plus petite capacité de cargaison que les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]caraques[COLOR_REVERT], elles sont cependant plus rapides et manoeuvrables.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] sind kleiner und haben weniger Frachtraum als [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karracke[COLOR_REVERT]. Dafür sind sie schneller und maneuvrierfähiger.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] are smaller and have less cargo space than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT], but faster and more maneuverable on the other side.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] are smaller and have less cargo space than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT], but faster and more maneuverable on the other side.

TEXT.English: %D1: "We are upset that you have fallen under the sway of a heathen religion."

TEXT.Spanish: %D1: "Nos trastorna que hayáis caído bajo el influjo de una religión infiel."

TEXT.English: [TAB]Totem Poles were a tradition of the Native American tribes of the Pacific Northwest. Built from Oregon to Alaska, the Totem Pole is a visual representation of various tribal legends or important occurrences. [PARAGRAPH:1]While not worshipped, Totem Poles were often revered as symbols of wealth and common heritage. Yet some Totem Poles acted as warnings, rather than testaments. "Shame Poles" could be constructed to remind a tribe of a particular debt or offense. One particularly controversial pole, now found in the Alaska State Museum, bears the image of President Abraham Lincoln. Some claim that the "Lincoln Pole" was built to honor the passage of the Emancipation Proclamation, while many believe that it was built to mourn the wealth lost by the Tlingits tribe when forced to free their slaves.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les totems sont une tradition des tribus amérindiennes du Nord-ouest du Pacifique. De l'Oregon à l'Alaska, le totem est une représentation visuelle de diverses légendes tribales ou d'événements importants.[PARAGRAPH:1]Même s'ils ne font pas l'objet d'un culte, les totems sont souvent révérés en tant que symboles de richesse et d'héritage commun. Toutefois, certains totems font office d'avertissement plutôt que de témoignage. Des "totems de la honte" étaient parfois érigés pour rappeler une dette ou un événement honteux survenu à une tribu. Un totem particulièrement controversé, aujourd'hui abrité par le musée de l'Etat de l'Alaska, porte l'image du président Abraham Lincoln. Certains prétendent que le "totem Lincoln" a été construit pour honorer le passage de la proclamation d'émancipation, tandis que d'autres croient qu'il a été construit pour déplorer la perte de la richesse perdue par la tribu des Tlingits lorsqu'ils furent forcés de libérer leurs esclaves.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Totempfähle waren bei den Indianerstämmen an der Pazifikküste im Nordwesten üblich. Der Totempfahl, wie er von Oregon bis Alaska gebaut wurde, ist eine bildliche Darstellung verschiedener Stammeslegenden oder wichtiger Ereignisse.[PARAGRAPH:1]Obwohl sie nicht verehrt wurden, wurden Totempfähle oft als Symbole für Wohlstand und das gemeinsame Erbe betrachtet. Einige Totempfähle waren jedoch als Warnung, nicht als Erinnerung, gedacht. "Schandpfähle" konnten errichtet werden, um einen Stamm an eine bestimmte Schuld oder Beleidigung zu erinnern. Ein besonders umstrittener Pfahl, der sich heute im Staatsmuseum von Alaska befindet, zeigt das Antlitz Präsident Abraham Lincolns. Manche behaupten, der "Lincoln-Pfahl" sei errichtet worden, um die Emanzipations-Proklamation zu würdigen, während viele glauben, er wurde errichtet, um den Wohlstand zu beklagen, den der Stamm der Tlingit einbüßte, als sie gezwungen wurden, ihre Sklaven freizulassen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I totem erano una tradizione delle tribù native americane della costa nord occidentale del Pacifico. Costruiti dall'Oregon all'Alaska, i totem erano una rappresentazione grafica di diverse leggende tribali o di eventi importanti. [PARAGRAPH:1]Pur non essendo adorati, i totem erano spesso onorati come simboli di ricchezza e di comune retaggio. Alcuni totem però servivano da avvertimento, più che da testamento. I "pali della vergogna" potevano essere eretti per ricordare una tribù, un debito o un'offesa particolare. Un palo particolarmente controverso, che ora si trova nel Museo Statale dell'Alaska, reca l'immagine del presidente Abramo Lincoln. Alcuni sostengono che il "Palo di Lincoln" sia stato eretto per onorare la Proclamazione di emancipazione, mentre molti altri credono che stia a indicare il dolore della tribù Tlingits quando fu costretta a liberare i propri schiavi.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los tótems eran una tradición de las tribus indias del noroeste del Pacífico. Presentes de Oregón a Alaska, los tótems son representaciones visuales de leyendas tribales o sucesos importantes. [PARAGRAPH:1]Sin embargo, no eran objetos de culto, aunque sí, muy a menudo, símbolos de riqueza y herencia común. Algunos de ellos servían como advertencias, más que como testimonios. Los "postes de la vergüenza" podían levantarse para recordarle a una tribu una deuda u ofensa grave. Uno de ellos, especialmente controvertido y que se encuentra en el Museo del estado de Alaska, exhibe la imagen del presidente Abraham Lincoln. Algunos dicen que el "poste de Lincoln" se construyó para honrarlo por la proclamación de la emancipación, mientras que para otros es un lamento por la riqueza perdida cuando los tlingits se vieron obligados a liberar a sus esclavos.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Totem Pole[COLOR_REVERT], the Native American replacement for the [LINK=BUILDING_CHAPEL]Chapel[\LINK] among more primitive civilizations, grants a Bonus in [LINK=YIELD_HAMMERS]Production[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]totem[COLOR_REVERT] (bâtiment amérindien qui remplace le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]monument[COLOR_REVERT]) confère aux unités équipées d'un arc trois points d'expérience supplémentaires en plus du bonus culturel habituel.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Totempfahl[COLOR_REVERT], die indianische Variante des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monuments[COLOR_REVERT], gewährt Bogenschützen neben dem üblichen Kulturbonus auch 3 zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Totem[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente per i Nativi Americani del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumento[COLOR_REVERT], dà alle unità di arcieri tre bonus di esperienza, oltre al solito bonus alla cultura.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tótem[COLOR_REVERT], el sustituto indio americano del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumento[COLOR_REVERT], da 3 de bonificación de experiencia a las unidades de tiro con arco, además de la habitual a cultura.

TEXT.French: Autel sacrificiel
TEXT.German: Opferaltar
TEXT.Italian: Altare sacrificale
TEXT.Spanish: Altar de sacrificios:Altares de sacrificios

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sacrificial Altar[COLOR_REVERT], the Native American replacement for the [LINK=BUILDING_CHAPEL]Chapel[\LINK] among more advanced civilizations, grants a Bonus in [LINK=YIELD_HAMMERS]Production[\LINK].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]autel sacrificiel[COLOR_REVERT], version aztèque du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]tribunal[COLOR_REVERT], réduit le coût d'entretien des villes et la durée du mécontentement dû aux sacrifices de population. L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]autel de sacrifice[COLOR_REVERT] facilite ainsi la gestion des grands empires.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Opferaltar[COLOR_REVERT] der Azteken ersetzt das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gerichtsgebäude[COLOR_REVERT]. Er senkt die Unterhaltskosten einer Stadt und reduziert die durch die Opferung der Bevölkerung ausgelöste Unmutsdauer. Außerdem erleichtern [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Opferaltäre[COLOR_REVERT] die Verwaltung der Kosten großer Reiche.
TEXT.Italian: Gli [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]altari sacrificali[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente azteco dei [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]tribunali[COLOR_REVERT], riducono i costi di mantenimento della città e la durata del malcontento per aver sacrificato la popolazione. Gli [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]altari sacrificali[COLOR_REVERT] aiutano a gestire meglio i costi di vasti imperi in espansione.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Altares de sacrificios[COLOR_REVERT], los equivalentes aztecas de las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Delegaciones[COLOR_REVERT], reducen los costes de mantenimiento de las ciudades y la duración del descontento por sacrificar población. También ayudan a gestionar el coste que supone controlar un gran imperio.

TEXT.English: In Aztec culture, religion was inextricably woven into the fabric of daily life. The king was the leader of the nation; he also held high office in the religion. Aztec religious policies had the full force of law behind them. When a condemned criminal was executed, he was killed on the same sacrificial altars that the Aztecs used to sacrifice captured prisoners (and others) during religious rituals. [PARAGRAPH:2]Despite their bloodthirsty - even savage - reputation, the Aztecs had quite a sophisticated judicial system to protect both person and property. Each major city or town had a supreme judge. Once appointed, the supreme judge was totally independent of the monarchy; he wielded ultimate judicial control over his jurisdiction. Beneath the supreme judge was a three-member court, and beneath them were a group of lesser magistrates who were elected to their office by the people of the city. There is little evidence of corruption in the Aztec courts: judicial misconduct was punishable by death. [PARAGRAPH:2]Though the Aztecs could be considered barbaric by most modern standards, their justice system was fairly effective at deterring crime and keeping the peace. For example, there could not have been much theft in the cities: the Aztec residences were not equipped with locks or even bolts. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.French: Dans la culture aztèque, la religion faisait intimement partie de la vie quotidienne. Le roi était le chef de la nation mais il exerçait également de hautes fonctions religieuses. Les prescriptions de la religion aztèque avaient pleinement force de loi. Lorsqu'un criminel était condamné, il était exécuté sur les mêmes autels sacrificiels que ceux utilisés par les Aztèques lors des rites religieux pour le sacrifice, entre autres, des prisonniers. [PARAGRAPH:2]Malgré leur réputation sanguinaire, et même cruelle, les Aztèques disposaient d'un système judiciaire relativement sophistiqué pour protéger biens et personnes. Chaque ville ou bourg de taille relativement importante comptait un juge suprême. Une fois nommé, celui-ci était totalement indépendant de la monarchie et exerçait le contrôle judiciaire suprême sur sa juridiction. Sous son autorité, on trouvait une cour composée de trois personnes qui supervisaient un groupe de magistrats de rang moindre, élus par les habitants de la ville. Il existe peu de preuves de corruption dans les tribunaux aztèques, toute faute judiciaire étant passible de la peine de mort. [PARAGRAPH:2]Si, selon la plupart des critères modernes, les Aztèques peuvent être considérés comme des barbares, leur système judiciaire était relativement efficace pour prévenir la criminalité et maintenir la paix. Ainsi, il ne devait pas y avoir beaucoup de vols dans les villes car les résidences aztèques ne disposaient ni de serrures, ni de verrous. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: In der aztekischen Kultur war die Religion untrennbar mit dem alltäglichen Leben verbunden. Der König war der Anführer der gesamten Nation und bekleidete zugleich auch das höchste Kirchenamt. Die Glaubenspolitik der Azteken wurde in vollem Umfang durch die Gesetzgebung gestützt. Wenn ein verurteilter Verbrecher hingerichtet wurde, geschah dies auf den gleichen heiligen Altären, die die Azteken auch für die Opferung Gefangener (oder auch anderer Personen) im Rahmen ihrer religiösen Rituale nutzten. [PARAGRAPH:2]Obwohl man ihnen Blutrünstigkeit und sogar Grausamkeit nachsagte, unterhielten die Azteken ein relativ ausgefeiltes Rechtssystem zum Schutz von Leib und Leben sowie des Eigentums. In jeder größeren Stadt gab es einen obersten Richter, der nach seiner Ernennung völlig unabhängig von der Monarchie agieren konnte und somit bei seiner Urteilsfindung die ultimative richterliche Gewalt innehatte. Dem obersten Richter unterstand zudem ein dreiköpfiges Gerichtsgremium, dem wiederum eine Gruppe niederer Magistrate unterstellt war, welche durch die jeweilige Stadtbevölkerung in ihr Amt gewählt wurden. Hinweise auf Korruption an den aztekischen Gerichtshöfen gibt es kaum: Auf Rechtsmissbrauch stand die Todesstrafe. [PARAGRAPH:2]Auch wenn man das aztekische Volk aus heutiger Sicht durchaus als barbarisch betrachten könnte, so war ihr Rechtssystem im Hinblick auf die Unterbindung krimineller Machenschaften und den Friedenserhalt doch recht effizient. Ein Beleg dafür ist, dass es aller Wahrscheinlichkeit nach kaum Diebstähle in den Städten gegeben hat, denn die aztekischen Häuser waren weder mit Schlössern noch mit sonst irgendwelchen Sperrvorrichtungen ausgestattet. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Italian: Nella cultura azteca la religione era inestricabilmente intrecciata con la vita quotidiana. Il re era il capo della nazione e anche gran sacerdote. Le politiche religiose azteche avevano la forza della legge dalla loro. I criminali venivano giustiziati sugli stessi altari sacrificali usati per i prigionieri e per altri tipi di vittime durante le cerimonie religiose. [PARAGRAPH:2]Nonostante la loro reputazione di barbari assetati di sangue, gli Aztechi vantavano un sistema giudiziario a protezione dell'individuo e della proprietà alquanto complesso. In ciascuna città o villaggio era insediato un giudice supremo. Una volta nominato, il giudice supremo era totalmente indipendente dal re e deteneva il pieno controllo giudiziario sulla sua giurisdizione. Sotto di lui operava una corte di tre membri e, sotto di questi, numerosi magistrati inferiori eletti dai cittadini. Non abbiamo molte testimonianze di corruzione nelle corti azteche: simili reati erano puniti con la morte. [PARAGRAPH:2]Gli Aztechi potrebbero forse essere considerati dei barbari alla luce degli standard moderni, ma il loro sistema giudiziario era molto efficace nel prevenire i crimini e nel mantenere la pace sociale. Le case non venivano chiuse con lucchetti o spranghe, eppure il tasso di furti era molto basso. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Spanish: En la cultura azteca, la religión estaba indisolublemente unida al tejido de la vida cotidiana. El rey era el líder de la nación y también el magistrado religioso más importante. La policía religiosa azteca contaba con el respaldo de la ley. Cuando un reo era ejecutado, la ejecución se producía en el mismo altar que los aztecas utilizaban en los rituales religiosos para sacrificar a los prisioneros capturados. [PARAGRAPH:2]A pesar de su fama de sanguinarios e incluso salvajes, los aztecas tenían un sistema judicial bastante sofisticado para proteger tanto a la persona como la propiedad. Todas las ciudades importantes tenían un juez supremo. Una vez nombrado, el juez supremo era totalmente independiente de la monarquía y ejercía un control judicial total en su jurisdicción. Bajo el juez supremo había una corte de tres miembros y, bajo ella, un grupo de magistrados menores que eran elegidos por la población de la ciudad. No existen apenas evidencias de corrupción en las cortes aztecas. La prevaricación se castigaba con la muerte. [PARAGRAPH:2]Aunque, desde una perspectiva moderna, los aztecas podrían ser considerados bárbaros, su sistema judicial era bastante eficaz a la hora de combatir el crimen y mantener el orden. Por poner un ejemplo, no debía de haber muchos robos en las ciudades: las residencias de los aztecas no tenían cerraduras ni candados. [PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Windmills[COLOR_REVERT] allow better milling of flour from grain, increasing [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] production through higher productivity. In a colony that is located on a [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVERS]riverbank[\LINK], it can be replaced by the [LINK=BUILDING_WATERMILL]Watermill[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information about Food production, see [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Food[\LINK].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]moulins à vent[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]moulins à eau[COLOR_REVERT] permettent de meuler vos récoltes, ce qui a pour conséquence d'augmenter la production de nourriture dans votre ville.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Windmühlen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wassermühlen[COLOR_REVERT] verbessern die Produktion von Mehl. Dadurch wird der Nahrungsertrag der Stadt gesteigert.

TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Windmühlen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wassermühlen[COLOR_REVERT] verbessern die Produktion von Mehl. Dadurch wird der Nahrungsertrag der Stadt gesteigert.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Windmills[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Watermills[COLOR_REVERT] allow better milling of flower from grain. Thus they increase food production through higher productivity.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Windmills[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Watermills[COLOR_REVERT] allow better milling of flower from grain. Thus they increase food production through higher productivity.

TEXT.English: Due to a lack of evidence, there is a debate among historians as to whether or not Middle Eastern windmills triggered the original development of European windmills.In northwestern Europe, the horizontal-axis or vertical windmill (so called due to the plane of the movement of its sails) is believed to date from the last quarter of the 12th century in the triangle of northern France, eastern England and Flanders. The earliest certain reference to a windmill in Europe (assumed to have been of the vertical type) dates from 1185, in Weedley, Yorkshire, although a number of earlier but less certainly dated twelfth century European sources referring to windmills have also been found. These earliest mills were used to grind cereals.
TEXT.French: Le moulin à vent est un dispositif qui transforme l'énergie éolienne (énergie cinétique du vent) en mouvement rotatif au moyen d'ailes ajustables. En tant que moulin, il est utilisé le plus souvent pour moudre des céréales, broyer, piler, pulvériser diverses substances, presser des drupes ou écraser des olives pour produire de l'huile, ou même pour actionner une pompe, par exemple pour l'irrigation ou
TEXT.German: Aufgrund des Fehlens von Beweisen, existiert eine Debatte und Historikern ob die Windmühlen des Mittleren Ostens die Entwicklung der europäischen Windmühlen ausgelöst hat. Im nordwestlichen Europen, datieren horizontale oder vertikale Windmühlen vom Ende des 12ten Jahrunderts. Die ersten Windmühlen dienten ausschliesslich zum Mahlen von Getreiden.
TEXT.Italian: Due to a lack of evidence, there is a debate among historians as to whether or not Middle Eastern windmills triggered the original development of European windmills.In northwestern Europe, the horizontal-axis or vertical windmill (so called due to the plane of the movement of its sails) is believed to date from the last quarter of the 12th century in the triangle of northern France, eastern England and Flanders. The earliest certain reference to a windmill in Europe (assumed to have been of the vertical type) dates from 1185, in Weedley, Yorkshire, although a number of earlier but less certainly dated twelfth century European sources referring to windmills have also been found. These earliest mills were used to grind cereals.
TEXT.Spanish: Due to a lack of evidence, there is a debate among historians as to whether or not Middle Eastern windmills triggered the original development of European windmills.In northwestern Europe, the horizontal-axis or vertical windmill (so called due to the plane of the movement of its sails) is believed to date from the last quarter of the 12th century in the triangle of northern France, eastern England and Flanders. The earliest certain reference to a windmill in Europe (assumed to have been of the vertical type) dates from 1185, in Weedley, Yorkshire, although a number of earlier but less certainly dated twelfth century European sources referring to windmills have also been found. These earliest mills were used to grind cereals.

TEXT.English: Most watermills in Britain and the United States of America had a vertical waterwheel, one of four kinds: undershot, breast-shot, overshot and pitchback wheels. This vertical produced rotary motion around a horizontal axis, which could be used (with cams) to lift hammers in a forge, fulling stocks in a fulling mill and so on. However, in corn mills rotation about a vertical axis was required to drive its stones. The horizontal rotation was converted into the vertical rotation by means of gearing, which also enabled the runner stones to turn faster than the waterwheel. The usual arrangement in British and American corn mills has been for the waterwheel to turn a horizontal shaft on which is also mounted a large pit wheel.
TEXT.French: Un moulin à eau, ou moulin hydraulique, est un moulin utilisant l'énergie du courant d'un cours d'eau. Le moulin à eau, attesté en Europe depuis l'Antiquité (il est décrit dans le Traité d'architecture de Vitruve), est plus ancien que le moulin à vent. La plus ancienne machine à eau connue utilisant un système de bielles et manivelles est représentée sur un bas-relief du IIIe siècle après J.-C. à Hiérapolis en Turquie. La Scierie de Hiérapolis actionnait une paire de scies destinées à couper de la pierre.
TEXT.German: Die meisten Wassermühlen in Britanien oder den Vereinigten Staaten haten vertikale Wasserräder. Diese vertikal erzeugte Rotation um eine horizontale Achse konnte genutzt werden um Hämmer zu heben oder grosse Steine zu drehen, wie es in Kornmühlen nötig war.
TEXT.Italian: Most watermills in Britain and the United States of America had a vertical waterwheel, one of four kinds: undershot, breast-shot, overshot and pitchback wheels. This vertical produced rotary motion around a horizontal axis, which could be used (with cams) to lift hammers in a forge, fulling stocks in a fulling mill and so on. However, in corn mills rotation about a vertical axis was required to drive its stones. The horizontal rotation was converted into the vertical rotation by means of gearing, which also enabled the runner stones to turn faster than the waterwheel. The usual arrangement in British and American corn mills has been for the waterwheel to turn a horizontal shaft on which is also mounted a large pit wheel.
TEXT.Spanish: Most watermills in Britain and the United States of America had a vertical waterwheel, one of four kinds: undershot, breast-shot, overshot and pitchback wheels. This vertical produced rotary motion around a horizontal axis, which could be used (with cams) to lift hammers in a forge, fulling stocks in a fulling mill and so on. However, in corn mills rotation about a vertical axis was required to drive its stones. The horizontal rotation was converted into the vertical rotation by means of gearing, which also enabled the runner stones to turn faster than the waterwheel. The usual arrangement in British and American corn mills has been for the waterwheel to turn a horizontal shaft on which is also mounted a large pit wheel.

TEXT.English: [H1]CULTURE[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] is a measure of the degree of influence a settlement exerts upon its surroundings. Culture is not produced by units but by buildings (the list above details which buildings specifically), so the production of Culture increases when a colony develops. Every once in a while, a certain threshold is crossed, and the colony reaches a higher culture level, which is represented by its expanding borders. This opens up new lands and resources for the colony to utilize. When a rival European colony is near, and plots fall in the cultural domains of both colonies, the amount of Culture that is produced determines whose territory each plot will be.[NEWLINE]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders and Culture[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]When the Europeans colonized the New World, they of course also started spreading their own culture. The growing cities with their markets, churches, taverns and government buildings did not stay without influence for the Natives as well.
TEXT.French: Lorsque les européens ont colonisé le Nouveau Monde, ils ont commencé à propager leur culture. Les villes grandissantes, avec leurs marchés, leurs églises, tavernes et bâtiments officiels ne sont pas restées sans influence pour les indigènes.
TEXT.German: [H1]Kultur[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kultur[COLOR_REVERT] ist ein Masstab für den Einfluss einer Siedlung auf ihr Umland. Kultur wird durch die Bevölkerungsgrösse aber auch durch die Gebäude einer Stadt bestimmt. Die Produktion von Kultur einer Stadt, wächst also mit der Stadt mit. Wenn bestimmte Grenzwerte überschritten werden, so deht sich der Einflussbereich der Stadt aus, wodurch der Stadt mehr Geländefelder zur Nutzung freistehen.[NEWLINE]Für weitere Informationen siehe [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Kultur und Grenzen[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Als die ersten Europäer die neue Welt kolonisierten, verbreiteten sie natürlich auch ihren Einfluss und ihre Kultur. Die wachsenden Städte mir ihren Märkte, Kirchen, Tavernen und Regierungsgebäude blieben nicht ohne Auswirkung auf die Ureinwohner.
TEXT.Italian: When the Europeans colonized the New World, they of course also started spreading their own culture. The growing cities with their markets, churches, taverns and government buildings did not stay without influence for the Natives as well.
TEXT.Spanish: When the Europeans colonized the New World, they of course also started spreading their own culture. The growing cities with their markets, churches, taverns and government buildings did not stay without influence for the Natives as well.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Oxcart[COLOR_REVERT] are used for many centuries already. Oxes are strong but slow animals, thus Oxcarts are relatively slow also.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chars à boeufs[COLOR_REVERT] sont utilisés depuis de nombreux siècles avant l'ère de la colonisation. Les boeufs sont des animaux forts mais lents, ce qui ralentit l'achalandage.
TEXT.German: Ochsen sind enorme kräftige, aber langsame Zugtiere. Sie können in ihren Karren recht große und schwere Waren über weite Strecken transporieren. Allerdings brauchen sie dafür auch verflixt lange. Ochsenkarren werden schon seit vielen Jahrunderten benutzt.

TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Oxcart[COLOR_REVERT] are used for many centuries already. Oxes are strong but slow animals, thus Oxcarts are relatively slow also.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Oxcarts[COLOR_REVERT] are the most basic Land [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transport Units[\LINK] available. They are cheap to build and quite useful for transporting goods in the early game between cities that are close to each other. They require [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK] to be produced, but they do not require any particular building to be present in the settlement.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chars à boeufs[COLOR_REVERT] sont bon marché à construire et très utiles pour transporter des biens entre des villes proches les unes des autres.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ochsenkarren[COLOR_REVERT] können günstig gebaut werden und sind nützlich zum Transport von Gütern zwischen Städten, die nicht weit entfernt liegen.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Oxcart[COLOR_REVERT] are cheap to build and quite useful for transporting goods between cities that are close to each other.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Oxcart[COLOR_REVERT] are cheap to build and quite useful for transporting goods between cities that are close to each other.

TEXT.French: Convoyeur:Convoyeurs
TEXT.Italian: Carriage:Carriages
TEXT.Spanish: Carriage:Carriages

TEXT.English: Carriages are more expensive and need a plastered country road. However they are a lot faster than other vehicles and able to load more goods. So they are useful on big and gigantic maps in particular.
TEXT.French: Les convoyeurs nécessitent des routes pavées et cotent assez cher. Ils sont cependant particulirement plus rapides que les autres véhicules et peuvent charger davantage de marchandises. Ils se révèlent ainsi particuliè utiles sur les grandes cartes.
TEXT.German: Fuhrwerke sind zwar schwieriger und teurer zu bauen als Wagenzüge oder Trecks und benötigen dazu auch noch eine befestigte Landstraße um darauf zu fahren, aber sie sind viel schneller und können viel mehr transportieren.
TEXT.Italian: Carriages are more expensive and need a plastered country road. However they are a lot faster than other vehicles and able to load more goods. So they are useful on big and gigantic maps in particular.
TEXT.Spanish: Carriages are more expensive and need a plastered country road. However they are a lot faster than other vehicles and able to load more goods. So they are useful on big and gigantic maps in particular.

TEXT.English: Carriages reflect the development and strengthening of a road system in the new world. Carriages are very useful for a strong and powerful economy.
TEXT.French: Les convoyeurs reflètent le dveloppement et le renforcement de votre réseau routier dans le nouveau monde. Les convoyeurs sont très utiles pour développer une économie riche et puissante.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Erst nach und nach entstand in der neuen Welt ein mehr oder weniger gut ausgebautes Straßennetz. Auf dem Land kam man meist über Feldwege, die als "Straßen" bezeichnet wurde nicht hinaus. Erst mit der beginnenden industriellen Entwicklung folgte auch der Ausbau der Infrastruktur und dies besonders in den größeren Ortschaften oder Städten.
TEXT.Italian: Carriages reflect the development and strengthening of a road system in the new world. Carriages are very useful for a strong and powerful economy.
TEXT.Spanish: Carriages reflect the development and strengthening of a road system in the new world. Carriages are very useful for a strong and powerful economy.
